answers.answer: I'm not a Dr and we can't Dx anyont here... this is alot of stuff your going through... re you seeing specialist for all this...they are the ones to talk to with this.Sorry to hear your going through this...take care

question: i have diabetes 2, high cholesterol, high blood pressure, and have suffered from sleep apnea for 8 years without being diagnosed.  in july of this year, i had 8 trans ischemic attacks, the final one leaving me flat on the floor. all movement came back in 20 minutes.  went to hospital and my heart stopped and i stopped breating 13 times in 3 days.  found out i have sleep apnea and my heart slows to less than 10bpm and i stop breathing for up to a minute. i have apnea events over 80 times per hour and my oxygen levels drop to less that 60 percent.  i have a stenosis in my cranial artery that is inoperable unless i have more strokes.  recommended that i need a pacemaker.  i am on drug therapy, havent had any more strokes, but i have tingling in arms, hands and feet, my neck is always sore and i have headaches all the time.  i have strong muscle pain in my arms and legs and i cant hardly lift a sixpack of water bottles. i used to be strong as an ox. i also have pain in my legs, but i especially have pain in my forearms, and can not open jars or bottles without severe pain. i am always tired, i sleep all the time, i forget many things, leaving keys in my front door, cant think clearly, drop things all the time. and i have problems with my vision not being clear. i am on a cpap but only for 1 week so far, i am still waking up gasping for air. the docs are waiting on pacemaker now, i think they are scared.  and my primary physician keeps asking when am i going to go back to work. i was told that i have auto immune disease but the rhuematologist didnt find anything.  i am living in germany and it is hard to express one's feelings and moods when it is not your mother tongue.  does this sound like i could have ms.
title: don't know where to go from here
